intro: Acmopyle sahniana, commonly known as the Sahns' acmopyle, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
